p: Similar to other phenolic compounds, the antiviral effect of resveratrol has been tested in models, such as IAV in MDCK cells, EBV in Raji and human B cells, HSV in VERO and MRC-5 cells, RSV in lung epithelial cells, and HIV-1 in primary peripheral blood lymphocytes [ 106]. The anti-flavivirus activity of resveratrol was proven against ZIKV in Huh7 cells, and the mechanisms were related to postentry and virucidal activity and adsorption inhibition (MOI 1; 80 ÂµM) [ 107]. Anti-HCV activity could not be proven, and treatment with resveratrol even enhanced replication in OR6 cells [ 108].
